remarks.format: ## Remarks Data-bound controls use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class to request that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> object perform additional data-related operations on a results set, such as sorting the data or returning a specific subset of data. These data-related operations are enumerated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceSelectingEventArgs.Arguments%2A> property is read-only, so you can examine, but not change, the arguments that are passed by the data-bound control. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> object is performing data retrieval and data source paging is enabled, the data retrieval method is called twice:
- Once to retrieve the set of data.
- Once to retrieve a total row count.
This raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Selecting> event twice. For code that handles the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource.Selecting> event, it might be important to determine the nature of the event (retrieving data or retrieving row count) so that any additional work that is performed by the handler is not unnecessarily duplicated for every data retrieval operation that is performed.
